subject: Re: [junit] testing abstract methods
msgSnippet: hi Kumar I m trying to test non abstract methods in an abstract class which has been inherited by child classes.but i need not to test  abstract parent class
messageBody:
hi Kumar

I'm trying to test non abstract methods in an abstract class which has been inherited by child classes.but i need not to test abstract parent class via creating child class instances. Is there any way to achieve this using junit. please instruct me.
thanks..
chandima

----- Original Message ----
From: Kamlesh Kumar <kamlesh.kumar@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, January 4, 2008 4:24:59 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] testing abstract methods

Hi Chandima,

I m not getting your question properly...

Do you want to test abstract class or abstract methods ???

abstract methods cannot be tested as there is no logic written in them.
But you can test non abstract methods of abstract class.

Good Luk

[junit] testing abstract methods

hi friends ;
i'm using NetBeans as my development environment and i'm having an
abstract parent class caled "Vehicle" that has been inherited by o3 sub
clases namely Van ,Lory,...etc. when i want to test the parent class
which is abstract how could i do it as it doesn't let me instantiate.

choi
